column4: Hello, I'm having a dependency problem when trying to upgrade... I get errors that python2.4 is not configured yet, but it is installed, and I can't re-install it for the same reason.  Could anyone help with this?
can you pastebin the error?
sure. Thanks.
http://pastebin.com/d2152bfa3 This same thing happens when I try to upgrade anything.
why are you installing python 2.4?
well, I'm not really. I just wanted to do a system update, and found nothing dependent on python2.4 (which is practically everything) will not update.
I meant nothing WILL update. Due to dependencies. So I thought about uninstalling pyton2.4 and reinstalling, but that would require removing about 130 programs along with it.
try this: sudo apt-get --purge remove python2.4 python2.4-minimal python2.4-dev python2.4-gdbm python2.4-tk
wait
wrong command
sudo dpkg --purge remove python2.4 python2.4-minimal python2.4-dev python2.4-gdbm python2.4-tk
will that affect anything that depends on python2.4, like evolution, eg.?
then sudo apt-get clean, and then try again maybe
I think it will leave it in a broken state, btw, are you running hardy?
I didn't understand 'sudo apt-get clean?
its another command, that you run on a terminal
6.06 LTS
ah, well, give it a go, then install ubuntu-desktop and linux-generic.  If you need help with the commands for those, I can help there too.  And you should think about upgrading to hardy
I'm not very knowlegeable. Install linux generic? desktop? BTW I have a great deal of important stuff on this box I can't afford to lose...
both of those packages are essential for the operation of your system
also, you may want a separate /home.  I dunno
I can't remove python 2.4 because lots of other things depend on it. The command doesn't work. Same thing. Can't remove it, can't upgrade it. ARGHH!
try this : sudo dpkg --force-depends --purge python2.4-minimal python2.4 python2.4-dev python2.4-gdbm python2.4-tk && sudo apt-get clean && sudo apt-get -f install
